meanings.definition: Insignificant or worthless person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The little pissant didn't even bother to show up for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to that pissant, they don't know what they're talking about.
meanings.sent3: The boss called him a pissant for forgetting his own birthday.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a pissant in the vast ocean of corporate giants.
meanings.sent5: The bully's words made him feel like a tiny pissant in a big world.

meanings.sent1: I can't stand that pissant who always interrupts everyone.
meanings.sent2: The neighbor's dog barking all night is a real pissant.
meanings.sent3: The class clown was being a real pissant during the test.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a pissant in the presence of the school bully.
meanings.sent5: The politician's lies made him seem like a deceitful pissant.

meanings.sent1: He found a pissant pebble in his shoe after the hike.
meanings.sent2: The pissant bug crawled slowly across the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The pissant amount of money he earned was barely enough to buy lunch.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, his opinion was just a pissant whisper.
meanings.sent5: The pissant flower bloomed quietly in the corner of the garden.
